channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Godfather of AI’ Geoffrey Hinton predicts 2026 will see the technology get even better and gain the ability to ‘replace many other jobs’
item.description: "It's already extremely good. We're going to see it having the capabilities to replace many, many jobs."

item.title: California tech founders unload on a proposed state wealth tax that already has some billionaires preparing an escape. ‘I am screwed for life’
item.description: "One market correction, nationalization event, or prohibition of divestiture (not at all uncommon during wartime) and I am screwed for life."

item.title: Get Rid of the ‘Kiddie Table’ At Work and Treat Employees Like Engaged Partners
item.description: If you want more responsible employees, share more responsibility.

item.title: Here are the best free tools for discovering new music online
item.description: This article is republished with permission from Wonder Tools , a newsletter that helps you discover the most useful sites and apps. I love apps like ...

item.title: These devastating photos show the chaos of Trump’s mass deportation campaign in 2025
item.description: On day one of Donald Trump’s second term as president, he issued a wave of executive orders to radically expand the enforcement of immigration law. It...

item.title: End the Work Year with Gratitude and Apologies
item.description: Gratitude is an essential element of business relationships, but apologies might make an even greater impact.

item.title: Most resolutions collapse by February. Here’s the system high performers use instead
item.description: It’s a new year, which means millions of people are setting resolutions they genuinely want to keep. We want to eat better. Move more. Make more money...

item.title: How this retirement community is using virtual reality to help residents build social connections
item.description: Like many retirement communities , The Terraces serves as a tranquil refuge for a nucleus of older people who no longer can travel to faraway places o...

item.title: 5 Innovations That Turned Industries Upside Down in 2025
item.description: From autonomous robotaxis, to blind box and nostalgia marketing here are 5 of the most innovative business moves and trends in 2025.

item.title: Should leaders always be true to their values?
item.description: Few things seem more obvious and unquestionable than the notion that leaders should always be true to their values, no matter what. This widely-endors...

item.title: The retirement of this notoriously finicky card marks the end of an era for one of the world’s oldest and largest transit systems
item.description: The last day to buy or refill a MetroCard is Dec. 31, 2025, as the transit system fully transitions to OMNY, a contactless payment system.

item.title: Bank of America’s Moynihan sees Trump’s tariffs starting to de-escalate
item.description: “To go from a 10% across-the-board to 15% for the broad base of countries — not a huge impact,” Moynihan said.

item.title: How to Break the Self-Improvement Loop That’s Burning You Out
item.description: Start off the new year right by breaking the dizzying cycle of productivity for productivity’s sake.

item.title: This Warren Buffett-backed wildlife rehab center estimates not having old newspapers to use would create more than $10,000 a year in new costs
item.description: The physical paper is joining the pay phone, the cassette tape, the answering machine, and the bank check as objects whose disappearance marks the pas...

item.title: I Once Landed for a Business Meeting Already Exhausted and Knew I’d Made a Mistake
item.description: When you travel for work, the trip isn’t the job. How you show up after it is.
